com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.tuples.storage

Class JDBCTupleStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.tuples.storage.JDBCTupleStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDataStorage<ITupleSetDescriptor,ITupleSet>, IReadOnlyDataStorage<ITupleSetDescriptor,ITupleSet>, IReadOnlyTupleStorage, ITupleStorage
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MemoryTupleStorage

    public class JDBCTupleStorage
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITupleStorage
    Provides JDBC-based tuple storage. Actual database connection properties are defined in a properties object and optional properties prefix.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JDBCTupleStorage(java.util.Properties props)
      Create the instance without any property prefix.
      JDBCTupleStorage(java.lang.String propPrefix, java.util.Properties props)
      Create instance using JDBC connection properties defined in the given properties object The given prefix is optional, but if not will be prepended to the names of the properties we look for.

      • JDBCTupleStorage

        public JDBCTupleStorage(java.util.Properties props)
        Create the instance without any property prefix.
        Parameters:

      • JDBCTupleStorage

        public JDBCTupleStorage(java.lang.String propPrefix,
                java.util.Properties props)
        Create instance using JDBC connection properties defined in the given properties object The given prefix is optional, but if not will be prepended to the names of the properties we look for. Properties are as follows:
        • [<propPrefix>.]jdbc.drivers
        • [<propPrefix>.]jdbc.url
        • [<propPrefix>.]jdbc.user
        • [<propPrefix>.]jdbc.password
          Parameters:
          propPrefix -
          props -

        • createStorage

          public void createStorage(IApplicationDescriptor appDesc,
                 java.lang.String tableName,
                 java.lang.String sql)
                   throws DSMException
          Description copied from interface: ITupleStorage
          Use the given SQL to create the table in the database associated with the given application descriptor. The given tableName must match the name of the table being created in the given SQL statement. The database created must be unique to the namespace of the IApplicationDescriptor but NOT it's instance identifier.
          Specified by:
          createStorage in interface ITupleStorage
          tableName - name of table being created in the SQL statement.
          sql - valid SQL create statement to create the table.
          Throws:
          DSMException

          Specified by:

          Returns:

        • clear

          public boolean clear(IApplicationDescriptor appDesc,
            java.lang.String... names)
              throws DSMException
          Description copied from interface: IDataStorage
          Remove the value associated with the given data name.
          Specified by:
          clear in interface IDataStorage<ITupleSetDescriptor,ITupleSet>
          names - the name associated with the object in the storage. In general, this is the name of the data objects passed into IDataStorage.append(IApplicationDescriptor, ISharedData...).
          Returns:
          true if all names are present and could be removed.
          Throws:
          DSMException

        • query

          public ITupleSet query(IApplicationDescriptor appDesc,
              java.lang.String resultName,
              java.lang.String sql)
                throws DSMException
          Description copied from interface: IReadOnlyTupleStorage
          Execute the given sql against the given app and place the results in a tuple set with the name of an existing table within the app.
          Specified by:
          query in interface IReadOnlyTupleStorage
          resultName - this names an existing table within the app that could be used to store the results of the query. As such it is also the name assigned to the resulting tuple set.
          sql - query statement that generates results in the same schema as the identifier table.
          Returns:
          null if the named table does not exist, otherwise a tuple set with a tuple descriptor for the named table. The tuple set then contains the results of the sql query.
          Throws:
          DSMException - if the sql did not generate a schema that matches the named table.

        • delete

          public void delete(java.lang.String targetTable,
          ITupleSet tuples,
          java.lang.String... excludedColumns)
            throws DSMException
          Description copied from interface: ITupleStorage
          Delete from the identified table, the rows that match the given tuple values.
          Specified by:
          delete in interface ITupleStorage
          Parameters:
          targetTable - name of table in which rows are to be deleted.
          tuples - identifies matching rows in target table that are to be deleted. These tuples must have the same schema (i.e. column names and types) as the target table.
          Throws:
          DSMException
